Class Inst3a

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inst3a

  • public class Inst3a
extends java.lang.Object
    A three address code (TAC) instruction is composed of an operation code and three operands a,b,c; the operands are objects from the Operand3a class. The operation codes form an enumeration (TAC). The meaning of the codes is as follows:
    • ADD a = b + c
    • SUB a = b - c
    • MUL a = b * c
    • DIV a = b / c
    • NEG a = -b
    • COPY a = b
    • GOTO goto a
    • IFZ ifz a goto b
    • IFNZ ifnz a goto b
    • ARG arg a
    • CALL a = call b ou call b
    • RETURN return a
    • TABVAR a = b[c]
    • VARTAB a[b] = c
    • LABEL label a
    • VAR var a
    • BEGINFUNC
    • ENDFUNC

    When an operand is missing, it must be replaced by the null object in the constructor. For example: i = Inst3a(LABEL, a, null, null)

    Author:
    MLB

      static class  Inst3a.TAC
      Enumeration of all three-address code operators; most of them have self-explaining names.

      • the_Name

        private java.lang.String the_Name(Operand3a x)
        method for robustifying the toString method. If an operand is missing (null) a "####" is returned in place of the name. Otherwise, the name, as defined by the method getName3a is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - : the operand
        Returns:
        : a printable string

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints a TAC instruction. This method is put here for debug purpose only. TAC with type information is just an intermediate representation of the program. The printed form lack some information to be completely equivalent to the source program.
        The toString method is robustified for debug purposes. If an operand is missing (null) a "####" is returned in place of the name. Otherwise, the name, as defined by the method getName3a, is returned.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
